dtliExcerpt: The problem is that this version of “The Roommate,” working backward from that fact, delivers a pair of very satisfying performances that cancels out the play. You’ll remember LuPone’s sneers and Farrow’s tears — not what caused them.
showScoreExcerpt: “The problem is that this version of ‘The Roommate,’ working backward from that fact, delivers a pair of very satisfying performances that cancels out the play.”
bwwExcerpt: Most of what either woman says in “The Roommate,” which opened Thursday at the Booth Theater, is greeted by one or the other response.
